content.description: One statistic calculated for pitchers in baseball is called the earned run average, or <math alttext="E R A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ERA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The following boxplots summarize the <math alttext="E R A " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ERA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for pitchers in two leagues, A and B.
content.question: Based on the boxplots, which of the following statistics is the same for both leagues?

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
